resources.string: Days until you can go shopping again:
How many people use this item in your household?
2. How many times daily does an average member of your household use hand sanitizer?

string-array.name: resource_dirs
string-array.item: 2. How many times daily does an average member of your household use hand sanitizer?
2. How many times daily does an average member of your household use the bathroom?
2. How many water bottles does an average member of your household drink on a daily basis?

string-array.name: resource_hints
string-array.item: Daily hand sanitizer usage, if it\'s used in place of washing your hands, can vary based on daily activites, such as cooking, sports, caring for a sick family member, etc. however 11 times per day is a recommended baseline.
The average person uses the bathroom around 7 times per day, however, gender, age, and pre-existing conditions can cause changes to your daily routine.

Health authorities suggest the average person drink 64 oz. (1.9 L) of water per day, however, studies have found that the average daily water intake for Americans is around 40 oz. (1.2 L). This is subject to change based on weight and similar variables.

string-array.name: size_hints
string-array.item: Hand sanitizer bottles are usually around 8 oz. (0.24 L), however pocket-sized bottles are usually around 2 oz. (60 mL).
The number of sheets in a roll is generally found near the bottom of toilet paper packaging, however if the packaging is not available, single rolls are often around 150 sheets per roll.
The average tall water bottle is around 16.9 oz. (0.5 L), and the average small bottle is around 8 oz. (0.24 L).

string-array.name: calc_hints
string-array.item: Our estimations are generated by data sourced from: The Global Hygiene Council and CDC guidelines for hand sanitation.
Our estimations are generated by data sourced from: The Natural Resources Defence Council with data gathered by Statista\'s Consumer Market Outlook
Our estimations are generated by data sourced from: Mayo Clinic guidelines and data gathered by the U.S. National Health Nutrition Examination Survey

string-array.name: quotes
string-array.item: "Freedom is control in your own life" - Willie Nelson
